file_content.text: What? What did I do?
Next time we take a break I want to get my lekku buffed.
So, hey, I've been thinking... maybe you want to take this shock collar off?
You know, as a sign of thanks for my hard work on Korriban?
Not that I don't enjoy the perpetual fear of electrocution.
You will do as I say and not ask for favors.
Learn to obey.
Yeah, that's a real keen idea and all but what do I get out of it?
Each day is a present from me to you. Be grateful.
You get to live.
Gee, thanks.
That's a point. Behave and later, the collar.
Rewards come later.
You're serious? All right. I can do that. I think. Behave, Vette...
I gave you a chance. You are a slow learner.
Watch your tone. [Shock Vette]
You will mind your tongue, slave.
Enjoy this. [Shock Vette]
Ow! Forget I said anything!
You've earned it, Vette. It is not freedom, though.
Of course. [Remove Collar]
Wow, now I feel stupid for not asking sooner.
Don't worry, I'll try not to give you reason to slap that thing back on.
I expect your loyalty to remain absolute.
See that you don't.
Right. So what happens now?
Neither the collar nor your slavery were my idea.
Don't worry about it.
I hear you. Just another day in the life of the Empire, huh?
Well I'm not in prison or collared and it's sort of miserable weather, so I guess we should... uh, what happens now?
There will be no gadgets for future punishment. Just the lightsaber.
Next time you just die.
Oh, that's a relief I guess. No collar then... Um. So what happens now?
Just so you know, I'm here for the long term.
Whether that means more apprentices in the future or us adopting our own little hoard.
That's all I had to say.
Through apprentices trying to kill you and all the rest of the crazy, I'll be here.
Your deference is good and proper, Vette.
As it should be.
Okay then. Glad we're clear on that.
Are you saying I am not universally loved?
Who would try to kill me?
Oh, perish the thought. But I'll be here. Just in case.
It is good to have you by my side, Vette. It always has been.
I appreciate that.
You too, big guy.
You too, oh sweetest of Sith Lords. You too.
You wanted to talk?
More than talk. I told the crew to get lost for a few hours. Just you, me, and an empty ship.
We shouldn't waste a minute, then.
Let's make the most of it.
Already ahead of you.
What were you thinking we might do in those hours, wife?
Have something in mind?
I might surprise you. I found my old shock collar the other day... come on.
I can't just take a few hours off. I have responsibilities.
I've got things to do.
Yes. To your wife. Now follow like a good boy.
So worth the wait. We'll have to set aside a few hours every day...
Don't worry, I'll get Quinn to put it on your schedule.
Don't worry, I won't tell Jaesa what's keeping your schedule full.
Do you--do you love me?
With all my heart, Vette.
Yes.
Good. Me too. You know. With the love.
I'll give you a hint.
[Flirt] What do you think?
That answer your question?
I'm pretty sure I knew already.
I like you. And there are things I love about you...
Love is a strong word.
Right. Not so good with the bold statements. Believe me, I get it.
I need you to know... there haven't been any other men. Ever.
I promised my mother I'd be married first. About the only promise I managed to keep.
Vette, will you be my wife?
Then marry me.
Yes! Yes! and Yes!
We don't have to hurry this if you're not ready.
There's no rush.
I don't think you are following. I'm not feeling rushed. I love you.
We should express our love however we want. Societal rules are for other people.
That's stupid.
I am other people. Not a Sith, not even Imperial. Just a girl.
So do you want to marry me? Yes or no?
Of course I do. You're everything I've ever wanted, Vette. I love you.
With all my heart.
I love you too.
Sounds like it could be fun. Let's get ourselves married.
Sure, why not?
I guess that's the best I'm getting.
Okay, don't laugh. Some of the Twi'lek marriage ceremony stuff is pretty goofy but it'll only take a couple hours...
There it is. Married.
Best thing that's ever happened to me.
Happy. [Kiss her]
We should plan to clear the ship out for some private time soon.
Yes, send everyone out to find a Force-sensitive k'lor'slug or something.
I behaved myself all the way through that crazy ceremony.
I didn't laugh!
Very proud of you.
Now that we're official I guess the romance will disappear pretty fast.
All downhill from here.
You are crazy. We still haven't gotten to the best part.
For now, things of galactic importance await as always, yes?
I'm a Sith Lord, Vette. I can't marry an alien. But that doesn't mean we can't have fun.
No. Not now, not ever.
Yes. It does. You've never really understood. But it's fine. We don't ever need to talk about it again.
I keep seeing that Hutt's face. And the blood. And the bodies on the floor. And Tivva's eyes.
I thought I could just let it go.
And I can't help blaming you.
I know it was hard, but some things need to be done. Bloody things.
That Hutt had to die.
I really hope I never understand the way you see the galaxy.
I should have known it would affect you this way. I wasn't thinking.
I'm sorry.
Yeah, well. Done is done I guess.
Don't try to put this on me, Vette. Your life. Your decisions.
You made your choice.
Says the person who used to have me in a collar.
Anyway. Whatever. Let's just keep some space between us for a while, okay?
Hey. You saved my life. You know that, don't you?
I don't mean literally. Okay maybe I would have died in that Hutt's bolt hole. But either way I wouldn't have come back the same girl.
I wasn't about to let anything happen to my girl.
I'm glad you're okay.
Your girl. I like that.
You're important to me, Vette. Have to keep you safe.
Glad you're okay.
Thank you.
I can be the dark force of revenge. You just be Vette.
Let me do the Sith thing.
You have yourself a deal.
Killing a fat Hutt wouldn't bring your mother back. It would just fill your nights with haunting images.
Revenge rots us.
I guess you've had enough of those to know. Thank you for protecting me from that world.
I knew you weren't cut out for storming a Hutt's hideout. You're too soft.
You're weak.
I'll take that as a compliment.
Tivva called. She was fine after she cooled off--she was always like that. Maybe you saved her, too.
Anyway. Just wanted you to know.
She found her! She found her!
Mother was sold to a Hutt on Tatooine years ago. She works in a small shop there.
Tivva found her, and she's headed to Tatooine already. We need to go meet her as soon as we can!
Of course. We'll wrap up what we're doing and make our way to Tatooine.
All right. We'll go soon.
You're the best!
Relax, Vette. Breathe.
Calm down!
I am breathing! Okay, calmer.
If we go, we will go at the time of my choosing.
You don't give the orders.
Yes, yes. You're the boss. I get it. But this is important.
Oh and Tivva sent back not only the credits you spent getting her out of that awful place but a gift, a sign of respect from her old Moff.
Oh and Tivva sent back some of the credits you spent getting her free. What she could scrape up.
Okay, as soon as we can. Tatooine. I wonder what Mother will think of me now?
So Tivva landed on her feet. She's started seeing a Moff stationed in the Outer Rim.
He's apparently like sixty years old, though. I don't know what to think.
All that matters is how they get along and feel about each other.
Does he treat her well?
You're surprisingly romantic sometimes.
I hope he's rich because that's a really disgusting thought.
That's gross.
I know, right?
At least my Sith Lord is young and handsome. Well, handsome enough, anyway.
I guess they can't have children anyway so it doesn't really matter. But still.
Time served in the galaxy means little compared to who a person is.
Age is just a number.
Smart and attractive. I need to listen when you talk more often.
Yeah. I guess you're right.
Anyway, Moff Old Guy apparently has all sort of contacts in Imperial Intelligence and I guess he's helping her find Mother.
I have dreams about the night they took me from her. Came in the night, pulled me off my sleeping mat. Just screamed and screamed.
You found Tivva. You'll reunite the whole family soon enough.
You'll find her.
I hope so. It's nice to know you believe in me.
Nobody is ever going to harm you again, Vette. Not while I'm here.
You're safe now.
Thank you. It means the galaxy to me.
I can't imagine how horrible that must have been.
Sounds terrible.
Yeah. Not fun.
When someone wants to sell their livestock, they don't ask the livestock's permission.
Slaves do as they are told.
Sometimes I think you get it and sometimes...
All right. Let's not go there right now.
I love you.
I love you.
Still weird.
You don't have to rush things, Vette. I'll be here.
[Flirt] This is sudden.
I love you too, Vette. And the idea of us is still new. Don't try to rush things.
I feel the same.
Thanks. I appreciate it. I know I'm a pain, I do.
Still... I love you. And that has to count for something.
Either go with it or let it go, Vette. You'll make us both crazy.
Stop being stupid.
Thanks. Just picked me right up there.
Let's go do something else, yeah?
You know, I think I'm getting better at the whole fighting thing.
Watching you pick targets for all those hours must have been useful after all.
You can learn many things from watching my example.
Be more like me.
I'll work on my glaring and tromping around next.
I don't need to pretend I'm an evil Sith Lord so I have free time for other lessons.
It's nice to see you improving your skills.
Congratulations.
Going to be a sharpshooter any day now. You just wait.
When you have something useful to say, let me know.
You are babbling.
Right. I'll do that.
Hello there.
Hey.
Don't worry. I'm not going to get silly again. I've had time to think.
It's not my place to judge why you're attracted to me. I just have to decide if you treat me like I want to be treated.
All right. You're judging. I'm waiting.
And what's the verdict?
I didn't mean it like that! I'm just--I don't know.
Just tell me how to make you happy, Vette. I'll be right there.
[Flirt] I take requests.
This is new territory for me. Need to open a Huttese plasma lock? That I know. But this...
It doesn't have to be complicated.
It's okay. [Kiss her]
Sith learn to go with their gut. What do your feelings tell you?
Search your feelings.
Hmm. A little hungry... thinking of Tivva and Mom... oh, there it is.
You're being a silly little girl. Come back when you can talk.
I'm done with this.
You don't know a thing about me!
We're not here for long discussions, Vette. You want to be my girl then you do what I say, when I say it.
Just do as you're told.
Yeah. See? That fails the whole "treat me like I want to be treated" test. Fails bad.
You're not the one setting the terms here.
Deal with it.
You are in for a rude awakening, oh Lord of Mine.
I'm a Sith Lord. I'm not good at giving up control.
I apologize.
Noticed that.
Nobody's perfect here but we'll figure it out.
Let me try a different approach.
How's this? [Kiss her]
Wow. Okay. Yes. That.
All right. More of that later. For now, um, back to business, yes?
What's on your mind, Vette?
I've been talking to Tivva.
We managed to scrape together enough credits to buy her freedom. Beg, borrow and... better not to say.
We've been trying to track down Mother.
First thing she did after you freed her was start trying to find Mother. I'm helping where I can.
How goes the search?
Any luck?
Aggravating. Standard Imperial databases aren't any help.
It seems like everyone else from your past is on the same moon.
Maybe try Nar Shaddaa?
Yeah, Nar Shaddaa's where we started. Nothing.
Another Cantina meeting? Get some new information?
Maybe hire that Kubaz again.
Tried it. Krata has nothing.
Mother wasn't that old when she had us. She has to be alive, somewhere.
Anyway. Just wanted to warn you there may be another detour in your future. Not that you'll be much help...
Anyway. Mainly wanted to thank you for Tivva.
It's sad that nobody else sees what a good person you are inside.
Nobody would ever guess what a wonderful person my Sith Lord friend was.
You wanted to talk?
I did it! Maybe you didn't think I could but I did!
A Kubaz tracker named Krata found my sister Tivva. Found where she worked, even the name of her boss.
She's on Nar Shaddaa! Can you believe that? Krata wouldn't tell me any more until I paid him but he found her!
No time like the present.
Let's go.
You. Are. The. Best.
We have pressing business, Vette. We can't just run off.
We're busy right now.
No, of course not. But soon, yes?
I care why?
Don't be a pain all the time, huh? You care because we're going to go find her.
We need to meet Krata the Kubaz in a cantina on Nar Shaddaa. I'll settle the bill with him, get the specifics and then see my sister!
Sometimes I think it's just better to be born male. At least if you're a slave.
I keep thinking of Tivva, my sister.
She wasn't strong enough to work in the mines but she got more beautiful every year. Mother tried to hide it with mud and filthy clothes.
She was afraid that if Tivva was discovered, she'd be taken away for other work?
You mother was scared.
Other work. That's putting it nicely.
There's only so much you can do to disguise a young beauty...
Did it work?
Yeah. Mother was dedicated, though. Broke Tivva's nose once when a buyer was coming.
If there's a choice, I always keep the attractive female slaves for the housework.
I like my slaves beautiful.
I disapprove of slaves distracting men from me. I have them killed outright.
Beautiful slaves should die.
Right. It was that kinda crazy we had to deal with all the time.
Anyway. I've got some credits put aside. I want to hire a tracker to find Tivva and Mother.
I just need to use the Imperial data files on board. Get some leads for the tracker to start with. That okay?
Of course, Vette. Whatever will help.
Anything you like.
You're the best!
I really couldn't care either way.
Whatever.
That's a yes!
Okay, next free moment I have I'll start running some searches.
You are not to put your clumsy hands on any of the equipment. Is that understood?
Don't touch anything!
Yes. I'll somehow have to make Quinn do it for me.
Yes. I'll have Jaesa do it for me.
Can't watch me all the time!
You've got a serious look in your eye.
First time for everything.
So Jaesa. Your apprentice. Just your apprentice?
Watch how you answer that.
Great. The queen of freaky is here, too. So you weren't... I'm so dumb.
Why? I'm very open-minded about sharing.
Eww. So... eww.
Jaesa is my apprentice, nothing more from now on. Jaesa, return to your quarters.
I want to be with Vette.
You are both going to regret this. Don't sleep too soundly, Twi'lek.
You had to know forcing me to choose would mean taking Jaesa.
I'm with Jaesa.
Yeah. But I had to give you the chance to be a man instead.
Look, we'll just pretend whatever it was never happened.
I am a Lord of the Sith. I will have both of you and you will accept it.
I deserve both.
No. I won't. Enjoy your insane piece of Alderaanian trash but don't ever look at me that way again.
Okay, so I've been thinking about you. About me. About all of that.
You're a super powerful Sith Lord who can have anything he wants. I'm a former slave and a thief. And you chose me? Seriously?
You're beautiful, charming, sometimes crazy and always exciting. What man wouldn't choose you?
[Flirt] Seriously.
Um. Yes. Speechless.
To be continued.
We shared a moment, but you seem to be reading a lot of significance into it.
What are you talking about?
Ugh. I'm sorry. I'm so stupid. I thought. Look, never mind.
We'll talk later. Promise.
You don't need to shut me down.
Vette, wait.
I really do. Sorry. I know it's. Look, just later, okay?
Until later, then.
I'll take you up on that.
Yeah. Later.
I'm not sitting around waiting for you, Vette.
I could care less.
Um, good to know?
I thought it would be fun to see you uncomfortable. Not interested, Vette.
No, I was just teasing you.
Of course you're--let's just pretend this didn't happen. Moving on...
What's on your mind?
Nothing. Why? You expect me to be all mopey? It's too nice outside.
Let's play Two Truths and a Lie. I tell you three things about me and you tell me which isn't true.
I'll play along. Go ahead.
If you insist.
Maybe you haven't been paying attention. I win all contests!
Game on. Bring it!
Okay, here goes. I've been in jail sixteen times. I've got three sisters. I've worked as a hired assassin. Which one is a lie?
You are far too young to have been in jail that many times.
The prison is a lie.
Ha! Totally wrong. Six times on Nar Shaddaa alone!
You only have one sister.
The sisters are a lie.
Yes, Tivva. Good job! I'll have to try something a bit more obscure next time.
There is no way you would take money to kill someone.
The assassin is a lie.
Turns out it depends on how much money and how much the person needs to die.
Okay, enough games. I wouldn't want someone to start think the Sith were getting fun.
Waste my time with nonsense again and I'll hurt you.
You are lucky I don't hit you.
Sith hates fun. Noted.
You know stand-in family is all well and good but seeing the old gang just made me miss my mom and sister.
Which is sort of weird. My memories are so old--I remember having the memories more than I remember the actual events.
Did that make any sense?
Sometimes it helps to just talk about it.
Tell me about your family.
I guess. Someday I'll have to do something more than talk, I suppose.
On the Vette Weird Scale, I'll give it a three.
You're cute and insane.
And on the Sith Joke Scale--hmm, I guess nobody's needed one of those before. We'll work one up later.
Right now I just think, what would Tivva be like today? The last time I saw my sister she was ten? Twelve?
Okay, enough of that. Moving along.
I'm too busy to play memory lane. Why don't you bug Jaesa about it?
Not now, Vette.
Yeah. That is not going to happen.
Maybe I will. What do you think of that?
You wanted to talk?
Nothing crazy. Just thinking about what happened back on Nar Shaddaa with the old gang.
Didn't realize until I saw Taunt again that I've always found stand-in big sisters.
First Risha, then Taunt. Now you.
It's a man's galaxy. It makes sense to find female company where you can.
We need other women around.
Exactly. Have to talk to someone who communicates in more than just grunts.
Shall we return to the business at hand then, my fine female companion?
I'm here whenever you need me Vette.
Sisters forever, kid!
You are an amazing woman. Plus we have the best making friends story. "So there I was being enslaved..."
All right back to Sith business. Grr!
You are an alien. I am a Sith. You are nothing I would allow in my family.
I am not your sister, freak.
Wow. Even for you that was... wow. Okay. Going to look somewhere else now.
When I saw Taunt flirting with you, I don't know. It was weird.
Always strange to see people you know in their personal lives.
Socially awkward I guess.
Don't worry. No other Twi'lek in the galaxy can turn my head like you do.
[Flirt] Wasn't her I wanted.
When you went off with Taunt I--I don't know. Learned something, I guess. I didn't like it.
You need to lighten up, Vette. Nothing wrong with two adults having fun.
You're closed minded.
Yeah, maybe. Taunt always flirted with our guy friends. Never bothered me before.
Maybe you were just in a weird mood.
Don't know what to say.
Hmm. Let's just drop it then. Do something else with our time.
I think you have a little crush on me. First time? Because I noticed it quite a while ago.
[Flirt] I like you too, Vette.
Keep your weird feelings to yourself. You babble is starting to annoy me.
I don't care.
You've never cared what I did before. No matter how hard I tried to make sure you noticed.
[Flirt] Jealous? Vette?
I don't get it. Really? But I'm nothing special. Just a normal girl...
You know what? Don't answer that. Let's just go back to what we were doing.
It is no business of yours what I do or who I do it with.
Mind your own concerns.
Clearly. Won't come up again. I promise.
You are never going to guess what I've been doing. No, no. Don't try. I'll tell you.
In between jumps I've been checking holo frequencies and I found the old gang. They're on Nar Shaddaa!
They weren't leaving messages for me in the old spots. I thought they got themselves caught or dead or something.
Are you thinking of going back to your old life?
So now you're leaving?
And leave you with just Quinn for company? Nobody's that cruel.
What? Are you worried I'll leave you?
That must have been very nice.
Good for you.
Was that you trying to be polite?
Did it ever occur to you that they didn't want to hear from you again?
Or they abandoned you.
No, it didn't occur to me.
Old gang's been on the run since I've been gone. Apparently our mysterious informant for the Korriban job was that scumsucker Cada Bliss.
Bliss sure got revenge for the job we pulled on him. Fake mission, fake cover story. I'm thrown in the slave pens and he hits the gang hard.
You're still alive. So the cycle of revenge can still complete.
You can turn the tables.
For once, I have to agree with your angry Sith thing.
So you could say he was our matchmaker?
[Flirt] I should thank him.
You are so weird.
At least we each got a new friend out of the deal.
Brought us together, though.
You are so sweet sometimes!
You mess with powerful people, you pay the price. A lesson from the galaxy.
Showed you, didn't he?
Yeah, well what if you've got more powerful people to back you up?
Once they escaped the mercenaries, Taunt and what's left of the old gang spent their last credits tracking Cada Bliss' movements.
That Duros snake has managed to get his hands on the Star of Kala'unn. It's a priceless piece of Twi'lek history. I want to get it back.
We'll find this Duros and make him pay for every slight against you and yours.
You want revenge. Good.
Tell me where we're going and I'm with you.
Do we have a location?
You're fantastic!
Do you want to leave for a while, Vette? Take care of this business?
Are you asking for a vacation?
No, silly. I want you to come with me and hit a Duros in the face!
Cada Bliss is at the spaceport on Nar Shaddaa, trying to line up a buyer.
I'll send a message that we're coming. Make us out to be interested buyers. Oh and I'll tell the gang to get ready to receive the artifact.
Bliss has some famous Kaleesh bodyguard they call "The Virus" working for him these days--but that's not going to worry you, is it?
You know I never thought much about being a Twi'lek when I was younger.
Even on Ryloth there were lots of other types of people. As far as I could tell people like me were just the ones who made the best slaves.
Wasn't much to be proud of, you know?
Your perspective changed as you got older?
And now?
It wasn't getting older, it was meeting Twi'leks that weren't helpless.
Not having role models can make identity complicated.
Must have been difficult.
You really surprise me sometimes. So mature. Not really what I'm used to.
Every species has a place in the Empire. Twi'lek exist to be in service to their superiors.
Your people make great slaves.
Every time I think there's a person under all that Sith I get a nice, sharp reminder. Sheesh.
Sometimes the old training dies hard. I did not mean it.
I apologize.
I guess we all have to live with what we are.
I have never tried to hide what I am, Vette.
I am Sith. That is all.
Yeah, I guess I just forget sometimes. Think I'm back with my own people.
When I left Nok Drayen's gang I joined up with a group of Twi'lek artifact hunters.
They were all young too, full of fire and Twi'lek pride. Out trying to recover our heritage.
So it wasn't just about stealing anything they could get their hands on. They wanted Twi'lek historical pieces?
They hunted Twi'lek artifacts?
Well, sometimes they took other jobs to pay the bills. But it was really about returning Twi'lek artifacts to Twi'lek owners.
I could see the appeal of young, excitable Twi'leks.
[Flirt] Young and fiery, hmm?
You should have met them. There was a girl they called Taunt, she was beautiful. Everyone loved her.
In the academy it was all competition and suspicion. It would have been nice to have people I could trust.
That sounds nice.
I never thought about that. Academy's not really a place to make friends, I guess.
I made friends in the new gang but it wasn't until we did our first job together that we were family.
There was this rich Duros scumball--Cada Bliss. Obsessed with Twi'lek women, artifacts, clothes--anything. We took him for everything he was worth.
That's quite a haul. I assume your little gang lived well for a while.
What'd you do with the money?
Not really. The Twi'lek groups who bought the artifacts weren't exactly rich. But we survived.
You said he was obsessed with Twi'lek women, did you have to rescue people along with the loot?
Did he have slaves as well?
Yeah and some of them weren't exactly in great shape. Wasn't much better than Korriban and they'd been there awhile.
This Cada Bliss sounds like a moron. He let a group of angry kids rob him.
He must have been an idiot.
He was a lot of things. Most of them terrible.
Anyway, we were flying high, did a couple more jobs together. Then came Korriban. And I guess you know how that ended up...
You mean they were a group of criminally minded infants trying to feel important.
Dumb children out for thrills.
Yeah, that's exactly what I meant.
I can give you stronger reminders of who I am if you need them.
Be glad I don't punish you.
I'm going to say "no thanks" to that one.
I'll just get back to work.
What does family mean to you? I mean does it have to be the people you're actually related to?
Bloodlines are what define us. That is family.
Blood is all important.
I don't know, maybe. I suppose my mother and sister will always be the most important.
Are you looking for a specific answer or just getting philosophical?
Is this some Twi'lek riddle?
Nostalgic, maybe.
When you are close to people they become family. Sometimes whether you want them to or not.
Family is what you decide.
Cute. I'm going to take that as a compliment.
When I was working for Nok Drayen, doing the pirate thief thing, he had a daughter my age. Risha.
It wasn't like Nok was super sweet to her or anything. But he'd call her Princess and I wished I was her.
You've only spoken of a mother and sister. What happened to your father?
Did you know your father?
Dead. Enslaved. Disappeared. We never really knew. Maybe that's why I wanted to be Risha.
Having someone your own age could be great or terrible, depending.
You and Princess get along?
It was great. Always great.
If you had killed her without her father knowing he might have turned his affection to you instead.
Should've stole his affection.
You are sort of insane. You know that, don't you?
Risha was smart and strong. She knew how to do everything around the ship and I went everywhere with her.
Suddenly, I had a sister again. For years it was Risha and me against the galaxy and anyone who gave us grief.
Did you drift apart? Start to fight?
What happened?
Nothing like that.
Memories of the best times in life are treasures later in life.
Sounds like a golden age.
Who are you and what did you do with the Sith I know?
Eventually Nok hatched some secret plan that I couldn't be a part of. One that apparently got them both killed.
But for a while there. I really was happy. Ugh. Enough of that.
I assume you failed to follow her father's orders and destroyed your relationship.
You screwed it up, didn't you?
No! I... just forget it. You wouldn't understand.
Have you ever heard of Nok Drayen? Pirate? Terrified the criminal world for a few decades?
We didn't study many pirates in the academy.
I can't say that I have.
He wasn't just a pirate. He was "the" pirate. Galaxy's most wanted and all that.
He destroyed the Rath Cartel and the Vandelhelm Combine in some giant power grab. Same guy?
Syndicate Wars, right?
Yeah, same guy. Weird to think of him that way.
Nok Drayen was the most famous killer in the galaxy but he set me free.
I was still slaving it up for Three Eyes when he crossed Nok. Or maybe he just had something Nok wanted. I never did ask.
Did any of the gang survive the encounter?
I assume Three Eyes died.
You mean anyone that wasn't owned as property? No they did not.
So at one point you did know how to keep your mouth shut?
A good slave doesn't question.
Yeah, I was an abused, well-behaved little ball of nightmares.
I'm still not sure how Nok got his speeders into the camp. One minute they weren't there, then they were.
He was ruthless but not a thug, you know? Sort of a pirate prince. Freed all the slaves and told them they could join up or go their own way.
I assume you saw the opportunity for plunder and seized it.
So you joined a pirate crew.
Well I wasn't going to go wander off on whatever waste of a planet we were on.
I'm surprised he allowed a child to make that kind of decision.
But you were, what, eight?
He was like that. Never once talked differently to me. Not sure he really understood kids.
To truly lead and inspire fear, people must see that you are in control.
Power and nobility. Good mix.
That was Nok. Cool as the belly of an ice lizard.
I was smallest on the crew and mining had taught me to fit in tight spaces. Nok's crew showed me how to steal.
For a long time I didn't feel bad about stealing. So much had been taken from me...
Even the small action of taking gave you control of your life. That is everything.
It is good to have power.
It must have been hard for you.
I'm so sorry.
Well it's a long time ago anyway. Let's get back to work, yeah?
You're pathetic. Live in the moment or you'll drown in your past.
Grow up and get over it.
Yeah, thanks for that.
Is there a point to this, or are you just testing my patience?
Seriously Vette, shut up.
Until you have something interesting to talk about, put a head tentacle in that mouth.
Nobody cares, Vette.
Wow. Someone's in a foul mood. Foul-er mood. Whatever.
You know I was a slave when I was a little girl. Before I got free. Sort of full circle, I guess.
You work for a Sith, as all in the Empire do. But your collar has been removed.
You serve; you're not a slave.
Right. I do appreciate the difference, believe me.
Many of your people are born into slavery. Is that what happened to you?
Tell me about it.
Near enough.
My mother and sister and I were grabbed when I was little. I don't remember much of it.
We worked the mines on Ryloth, then they separated us. I got sold to a Rodian, then a Hutt, then some sort of weird three-eyed thing.
I'm guessing your masters found you more trouble than you were worth.
You were a pain, weren't you?
Har har. Yeah, so I was never going to get slave of the year.
All of this while you were still a child?
And you were how old?
Yeah, I was seven or eight by the time I landed with three eyes.
Anyway, I guess you know you've moved around too much when a Sith ship starts to feel like home.
You've learned to be adaptable. That's a good thing.
Its a sensible response.
Make the best of it, yeah? Thanks for the talk.
This is home. And this is our strange little community.
Belonging somewhere is good.
Yeah, maybe. Watch out I don't start calling you "mama".
I guess you're right. Watch out I don't start calling you "pops".
You're here whether you like it or not. You may as well learn to like it.
Home is where I say it is.
That's about what I figured.
I wasn't trying to get your life story.
I'm sorry I asked.
I have little to no interest in your life history.
Vette? Shut up.
Right. Sorry. Only shuttle port in the storm, you know? Next time I'll just bond with the nav computer.
You wanted to talk?
I don't know. Something's wrong. With us. With you. Or maybe just me.
Tell me what's wrong.
Talk to me, Vette.
I don't even know. Don't you get it? No. Of course you don't. Ignore me, I'm crazy.
Whatever it is, I'll take care of it.
I'll fix it.
Not everything can be fixed!
Forget it. Let's talk later.
I don't have time for crazy right now. Do you have anything useful to say?
Make sense or shut up.
No. I guess I don't.
Am I some sort of game to you? Some freaky Sith experiment? Is that what I am?
Is everything all right in Vette Land?
Are you okay?
No, it's not. I feel like you're ignoring me. Or you don't care what I say.
But let's not make it a big thing, okay? I said my piece. So that's that.
Sure, you're a game. But a really fun game I want to keep playing.
[Flirt] The best game.
What is wrong with you? You know what, don't even answer. Let's just... not talk.
Of course. I spend all this time and attention on you because I'm not serious.
Yes, idiot. You're a game.
Fine. Sorry. I was being stupid. I can do that on my own time.
What's going on, Vette?
Nothing, that's what's going on. Nothing between you and me.
We are done. Forever. I'll still be crew but no flirting, no smooth moves, no romantic looks. Done.
Vette, we can make this work. We can.
Don't do this.
Been there. Tried it. Didn't work. Now it's done. Just... let's give it some space.
If that's the way you want it.
Fine with me.
It is. And I guess you don't care. Which is kinda how we got here in the first place.
There was never anything to begin with. Just me killing time.
Shut up, Vette. You're dumb.
I hate you so much right now. Just, go please. We'll talk later.
I'm done talking to you. Take the collar off or go away.
I'll never take that collar off.
You're too much fun.
Fine. You know what? I'm getting used to it anyway. I might even buy a nice pair of matching boots.
Do you enjoy this as much as I do?
How's this? [Shock Vette]
No need to get so worked up.
Calm yourself. [Remove Collar]
What sort of game is this? You think you've broken me and now I don't need my leash?
The explanation would make little sense to you.
Something like that.
I'll never figure you out, Sith.
I've wronged you. I will make amends.
Forgive me.
You've what? Don't try to play your games with me.
It ever occur to you that I know where you sleep?
Then you're finally learning the Sith way.
That's a good girl!
Even with my eyes closed I can end your life.
I never sleep.
I hope I can change your mind.
It will be better, I swear.
Weirdo Sith. Seriously.
I just wanted to see you get your hopes up.
Kidding! [Put collar back on]
Doesn't even hurt anymore. You want it to be like this, fine.
Just don't expect one word of help beyond what I have to do.
Okay, I can't take this anymore.
Look, I throw myself on your mercy or whatever.
Please, just please remove this collar.
Let me see if I can find the right button.
Like this? [Shock Vette]
You must learn to accept your situation.
You are useful as you are.
But I'm going to die from this. Don't you understand?
You won't die, merely hurt a great deal.
There will be suffering, yes.
Hardly seems lethal, does it? I could do this all day...
From this? [Shock Vette]
Make your case. Quickly.
Convince me.
What? I... okay. I know... I know I've been lippy but I'm not that strong. I can't take living like this.
I feel like I'm rotting from the inside. Like I can't feel anything anymore that's not this collar.
You are weak.
Pathetic.
I never knew evil was so petty until I met you.
How is this? Better or worse?
This help? [Shock Vette]
Real nice. Jerk. You think that's going to break me?
I'm going to regret this.
Mercy, then. [Remove Collar]
Don't make me regret this.
Very well. [Remove Collar]
What? Oh, it's off! Hehe. Um, right. Look, I can move my head! Heh.
Sorry, this will take some getting used to. I thought I was going mad.
Um, so what happens now?
Okay, hey, Sith master person of questionable temper and such?
I've been extra good with the behaving. Did you notice?
So how about taking this shock collar off of me?
How about some pain instead?
No. [Shock Vette]
Give me your word that you'll still obey.
Promise to follow orders.
How about some non-obedience sort of following directions? Like a person, instead of a pet?
Looks like my pet still needs training.
Stupid. [Shock Vette]
That hurts! Do you not get that?
I enjoy this.
I do. [Shock Vette]
Argh! You drekki-- no. I won't let you bait me. Lead on, I'll be following like a good slave.
Learn to control your inane commentary and there will be less pain.
Then watch your mouth.
If you're quite finished?
Shall we move on?
You are an alien, why would I treat you like a person?
You're not a person.
At least I'm not a Sith which means I may have some spark of goodness somewhere!
Fine, fine. lead on oh Sith of Siths. Far be it for this wretched slave to take up more of your time.
You really can't be broken, can you?
You're strong. [Remove Collar]
I suppose it can't hurt.
Sure. [Remove Vette's Collar]
Ugh. That is such a relief. So, uh, what now? I mean, we're like a million miles from nowhere and you've got the only ship.
You will remain with me and help achieve my goals.
I lead, you follow.
Fantastic. Glad you could open up. We'll have to talk again sometime.
Never forget that you're my property. To be otherwise in the Empire would leave you in a... troubled position.
I still own you.
You've got a really twisted view of the galaxy, you know that? Ugh, let's just keep going.
You and me, working together. Taking down the galaxy. What do you think?
Can we try this as partners?
What? Er, well, of course... me and my buddy the Sith. Nobody's going to pick on me at school!
Sorry. Let's just get going, yeah?
Next time we're at the ship, let's talk.
When we get a chance, let's talk.
I don't really want to talk right now.
Lead the way.
We'll talk later. Promise.
Let's move on, shall we?
Well, I guess we're safe for the moment.
What? Are you worried I'll leave you?
Let's go do something else, yeah?
All right, don't be so pushy.
Whatever you say.
Um, so what happens now?
Am I missing something?
You are so weird.
All right! Back to Sith business. Grr!
You are sort of insane. You know that, don't you?
Don't get any twisted ideas in that Sithy head of yours.
I just can't wait to get back to my quarters and grab some shut-eye.
